newsitem.title: USA: Netscape to buy DigitalStyle, Portola.
newsitem.headline: Netscape to buy DigitalStyle, Portola.

text.p: Netscape Communications Corp said it signed definitive agreements to buy DigitalStyle Corp and Portola Communications Inc.

DititalStyle is a web graphics tools vendor. Portola makes high-performance messaging systems. As part of the acquisition, John Myers, a member of the Portola development team who Netscape said was instrumental in developing the IMAP4 e-mail protocol and other internet standards, will be joining Netscape.

Under the terms of the agreements, Netscape will buy 100 percent of the outstanding capital stock of both companies and will issue about 2.08 million shares of its stock, subject to adjustment. Based on Netscape's current share value, the total consideration for the purchases would be in excess of $56 million.

Netscape expects a "substantial portion" of the purchase prices will be written off as in-process research and development in the quarter in which the transactions close, which is expected to be the second or third quarter of this year.
